clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of a Novel Blueberry Supplement on Dry Eye Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of a Novel Blueberry Supplement on Dry Eye Disease (PLUM)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of a novel oral supplement (gummy bear) with blueberry powder on reducing dry eye signs and symptoms and assess its safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in ODSI score from Baseline
primary_outcome.description: The Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) is a 12-question validated questionnaire used to measure ocular symptoms, visual function, and environmental factors that may affect a patient's vision. The OSDI scoring scale ranges from 0 to 100. The lower the score, the more symptomatic relief from dry eye symptoms a patient experiences. Change between the score at baseline and the score at 4 weeks is reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Non-Invasive Tear Break-Up Time (NITBUT) from Baseline
primary_outcome.description: The time required for a dry spot to appear on the corneal surface after blinking is referred to as the tear film break-up time. The change in this time (measured in seconds) between baseline and 4 weeks is reported.

arm_group.description: Participants receive the blueberry gummy supplement
Participant receive the placebo gummy supplement

intervention.description: Gummy bear with no active ingredients
